TITLE: Prez Deuba and Acting Prez Khadka assigned to hold talks with Gagan and Bishwakarma: Deuba and Khadka to meet NC General Secretaries Thapa and Sharma to safeguard party unity.
BODY:
A meeting of the top leaders of the establishment faction of Nepali Congress (NC) has entrusted President Sher Bahadur Deuba and Acting President Purna Bahadur Khadka with the responsibility to directly hold talks with the party’s two General Secretaries Gagan Thapa and Biswo Prakash Sharma.

The talks aim to maintain unity within the party and avoid any divisions, participants of the meeting said. “No one wants the party to split. The President has initiated these discussions to ensure both the party and its vote base remain united,” said a senior leader, who attended the meeting.

Discussions with the General Secretaries are expected to take place soon.

TITLE: 29 polling stations in Palpa 'highly sensitive': According to Chief District Officer Binu Kunwar, 20 polling stations in Constituency No. 1 and nine in Constituency No. 2 are sensitive.
BODY:
The District Security Committee has categorized 29 polling stations in Palpa as highly sensitive.

According to Chief District Officer Binu Kunwar, 20 polling stations in Constituency No. 1 and nine in Constituency No. 2 are sensitive.

A total of 118 polling centres and 251 polling stations have been determined for the district, which has two House of Representatives constituencies

Out of 207,436 total voters in Palpa, 98,383 are in Constituency No. 1, and 109,053 are in Constituency No. 2. The number of new voters to be registered for the March 5 election is 6,110 in the district.

TITLE: SC upholds Rabi Lamichhane's custody in cooperative fraud case: The Supreme Court has upheld the Butwal bench of the High Court's decision to remand Rastriya Swatantra Party Chairman and former Home Minister Rabi Lamichhane in custody in connection with the Supreme Cooperative fraud case. With this ruling, Lamichhane will remain in detention until the Rupandehi District Court delivers a final verdict on the case.
BODY:
The Supreme Court has upheld the Butwal bench of the High Court's decision to remand Rastriya Swatantra Party Chairman and former Home Minister Rabi Lamichhane in custody in connection with the Supreme Cooperative fraud case. With this ruling, Lamichhane will remain in detention until the Rupandehi District Court delivers a final verdict on the case.

A division bench comprising Justices Dr. Nahakul Subedi and Bal Krishna Dhakal dismissed a habeas corpus petition filed by Lamichhane’s wife, Nikita Poudel, which had sought his immediate release from custody.

Following this Supreme Court ruling, Lamichhane will stay in judicial custody until the cooperative fraud case concludes in the district court. He will only be released if the court clears him of the charges. Moreover, he must be exonerated of all other related allegations to secure his release.

TITLE: NC reiterates demand for formation of parliamentary committee to probe cooperative fraud case: KATHMANDU, April 2: The main opposition party, Nepali Congress, has reiterated its demand to form a parliamentary committee for conducting a fair investigation into cooperative fraud, saying the name of Deputy Prime Minister and Home Minister Rabi Lamichhane is linked to the fraud.
BODY:
The main opposition party, Nepali Congress, has reiterated its demand to form a parliamentary committee for conducting a fair investigation into cooperative fraud, saying the name of Deputy Prime Minister and Home Minister Rabi Lamichhane is linked to the fraud.

The NC demanded that authority be given to such a committee to carry out investigations into the cooperative fraud case and bring out the truth.

Speaker Devraj Ghimire allotted time to NC lawmaker Ram Krishna Yadav after all the NC lawmakers stood from their respective seats as a protest in today's meeting of the House of Representatives (HoR).

Speaking in the meeting, lawmaker Yadav pointed out the need for a parliamentary probe into the cooperative fraud case, citing that a crisis of trust has surfaced after the investigation against Lamichhane was stopped with reconstitution of the government.

He said Home Minister Lamichhane should resign from the post based on ethics as he had taken a loan of Rs 800 million from a cooperative at a time when he was working at Gorkha Media Pvt Ltd and has still not cleared it.

Lawmaker Yadav also demanded an investigation against Minister for Labor, Employment and Social Security, DP Aryal, as he, too, has been found to be involved in another cooperative case, clarifying his party would not obstruct the House on other issues except the issues connected with the Home Ministry and Cooperative.

Urging the government to seriously pay attention to the issues raised by lawmakers in the House, he urged the government to raise hope among the people by ending impunity, and maintaining rule of law and good governance.

In response, Speaker Ghimire said his and the House's attention had been drawn to the issues raised by lawmaker Yadav.
